SENT.plain: We reported two patients showed similar clinical course after blood transfusion
Case 1 was 74-year-old female, received transfusion of 200 ml of whole blood from her son, because of hemorrhagic shock for fematemesis from gastric ulcer
After transfusion, she died of liver dysfunction and severe aplastic anemia
Case 2 was a 73-year-old male, received transfusion of three unites of concentrated red blood cells for anemia following the orthopaedic treatment
High fever and erythema was appeared suddenly after transfusion
He died of liver dysfunction and the autopsy was performed
In case 1 the diagnosis was transfusion-associated graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) and in case 2 drug-induced-aplastic anemia (DIAA) was suspected
Differentiating the diagnosis between GVHD and DIAA is clinically difficult
